definition: a step/a pace/walk/march/stages in a process/situation

sentences.english: A group of elegant young gentlemen were sauntering in the park.
sentences.chinese: 一群优雅的年轻绅士在花园里悠闲地漫步。

sentences.english: I thought I saw Susanna, Coming down the hill.
sentences.chinese: 在梦中见苏珊娜，漫步下山来相迎。
吉普塞人在树林里漫步。

sentences.english: They strolled though the market, his bibliophilic eye studying the wares.
sentences.chinese: 他们漫步地穿过市场，他藏书者的眼睛研究着展品。

sentences.english: This is the age at which they can wander and be induced to travel the wrong road.
sentences.chinese: 这是年龄，他们可以漫步和被诱导出行走错路。

sentences.english: One man is walking along the beach in Camptown, South Africa.
sentences.chinese: 清晨，一个人在南非开普敦海滩漫步。

sentences.english: Soyou can see so many automatons around you.
sentences.chinese: 所以你看见这么多机器人在周围漫步。

sentences.english: Anyone who does wander into town from the airport should do so carefully.
sentences.chinese: 从机场漫步到城市，任何人都应十分小心。

sentences.english: He sauntered along Oxford Street looking at the shopwindows.
sentences.chinese: 他沿牛津街漫步观看商店的橱窗。

sentences.english: He and his son wander through the Old City of Jerusalem, snapping photos as they go.
sentences.chinese: 他和儿子在耶路撒冷老城中漫步，一边走一边拍照。

sentences.english: The lovers roamed around the fields in complete forgetfulness of the time.
sentences.chinese: 情侣们漫步在田野间，完全忘了时间。

sentences.english: ONE of the biggest dangers beachgoers are being urged to look out for this summer is rips.
sentences.chinese: 这个夏天海滩漫步者最大的危险是被迫警惕巨浪。

sentences.english: I woke up from a dream to walk through the bamboo forest, can not help but feel sad and dreary up.
sentences.chinese: 我从梦中醒来漫步于竹林之间，心里不禁悲凉起来。

sentences.english: After hearing the results of his exam he walked around campus with a smile from ear to ear.
sentences.chinese: 听到他的考试成绩后，他眉开眼笑地在校园里漫步。

sentences.english: Then amble over to the theater and enjoy whatever movie is next playing.
sentences.chinese: 然后漫步到剧院，放什么就看什么。

sentences.english: I've meandered now from the downtown ferry terminal up to the Pike Place Public Market.
sentences.chinese: 我从渡船停靠的渡口一直漫步到派克公共市场。

definition: to wander about unhurriedly/to linger/to loiter
to go through/to bore through/to push one's way through
to take a walk/to go for a walk
to loiter (i.e. reluctant to leave)/to linger on
to go sightseeing/to spend one's leisure time wandering around
